subject: p11016935
Impression: PA and lateral chest compared to : Patient has had median sternotomy and aortic valve replacement. Sternal wires are aligned. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is normal. Emphysema is moderate to severe and apical predominant. A 6 mm nodular opacity projecting over the right second anterior rib could be a pleural calcification shown on the chest CT, 4:20 or a new lung nodule A lordotic view might be definitive. Lungs are otherwise clear of focal opacities. There is no pleural effusion or evidence of central adenopathy. Cement and fusions are present in two lower thoracic vertebral bodies, with only minimal loss of height, unchanged since. Findings were posted to the online record of critical radiology findings for direct notification of the referring physician, at the time of this dictation.
